alert.note: Alert for Tulare (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Tornado Warning issued January 10 at 5:15PM PST until January 10 at 5:45PM PST by NWS Hanford
info.description: The National Weather Service in Hanford CA has issued a * Tornado Warning for... Central Tulare County in central California... * Until 545 PM PST. * At 515 PM PST, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located near Three Rivers, or 20 miles east of Visalia, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Weather spotters reported funnel cloud. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * This tornadic thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of central Tulare County, including the following locations... Lemon Cove, Lindcove, Case Mountain and South Fork Campground. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
